title: TalosModelError: <class 'keras.optimizers.Nadam'> is not supported by lr_normalizer
body:
Hi, it looks like I have a similar issue with #477 but their solution of uninstalling tensorflow and reinstalling the development version of talos did not work for me. I have the following module versions:
talos = 1.0
tensorflow = 2.2.0rc3
keras = 2.3.1

I had an issue with my own training set so pasted the Iris example verbatim and ran into the error posted in the title. Link to your Iris example (step 4 is where the issue arises for me:
https://nbviewer.jupyter.org/github/autonomio/talos/blob/master/examples/Hyperparameter%20Optimization%20with%20Keras%20for%20the%20Iris%20Prediction.ipynb
```
Error:

---------------------------------------------------------------------------
TalosModelError                           Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-6-020ed0d28173> in <module>
----> 1 scan_object = talos.Scan(x,
      2                          y,
      3                          params=p,
      4                          model=iris_model,
      5                          experiment_name='iris',

~\anaconda3\envs\biotech_env\lib\site-packages\talos\scan\Scan.py in __init__(self, x, y, params, model, experiment_name, x_val, y_val, val_split, random_method, seed, performance_target, fraction_limit, round_limit, time_limit, boolean_limit, reduction_method, reduction_interval, reduction_window, reduction_threshold, reduction_metric, minimize_loss, disable_progress_bar, print_params, clear_session, save_weights)
    194         # start runtime
    195         from .scan_run import scan_run
--> 196         scan_run(self)

~\anaconda3\envs\biotech_env\lib\site-packages\talos\scan\scan_run.py in scan_run(self)
     24         # otherwise proceed with next permutation
     25         from .scan_round import scan_round
---> 26         self = scan_round(self)
     27         self.pbar.update(1)
     28 

~\anaconda3\envs\biotech_env\lib\site-packages\talos\scan\scan_round.py in scan_round(self)
     17     # fit the model
     18     from ..model.ingest_model import ingest_model
---> 19     self.model_history, self.round_model = ingest_model(self)
     20     self.round_history.append(self.model_history.history)
     21 

~\anaconda3\envs\biotech_env\lib\site-packages\talos\model\ingest_model.py in ingest_model(self)
      4     through Scan() model paramater.'''
      5 
----> 6     return self.model(self.x_train,
      7                       self.y_train,
      8                       self.x_val,

<ipython-input-4-7d2833fffdfa> in iris_model(x_train, y_train, x_val, y_val, params)
     13                     activation=params['last_activation']))
     14 
---> 15     model.compile(optimizer=params['optimizer'](lr=lr_normalizer(params['lr'], params['optimizer'])),
     16                   loss=params['loss'],
     17                   metrics=['acc'])

~\anaconda3\envs\biotech_env\lib\site-packages\talos\model\normalizers.py in lr_normalizer(lr, optimizer)
     25         lr /= 500.0
     26     else:
---> 27         raise TalosModelError(str(optimizer) + " is not supported by lr_normalizer")
     28 
     29     return lr

TalosModelError: <class 'keras.optimizers.Nadam'> is not supported by lr_normalizer
```
I assume this has something to do with a mismatch between the talos and keras versions but am currently at an impasse. I have uninstalled both keras and tensorflow to make them the same versions as the #477 to not effect so I have reinstalled them to their current versions as above. Any help with this is greatly appreciated. Thanks!
